Entries.default: "I remember the last time I talked to a god. Oh wait, this doesn't just happen to everyone else. "Well?"
"Captain, I would not interrupt your contemplation, but it is not every day I see someone commune with luminous adra, ekera?"
"As much as I like pretending nothing happened, perhaps we should talk about your episode with the adra..." He casts a sidelong glance at you.
"Had another one of your talks there, didn't you? You gonna share details, or do we gotta guess?"
"Vailian animancy has unlocked many strange properties in luminous adra, but it appears Watchers could teach them a few tricks. What did you see in there?"
"I love hugging big shiny rocks much as the next freebooter, but mayhaps you want to be explaining the whole insensate drooling bit, captain."
"You were gabbing with my god again. Weren't you?"
"When the captain goes all starry-eyed like that, the crew starts to ask questions."

"I have known priests to go mad from too much incense, but speaking with a god has not left such a deep scar in you." 

Tekēhu cranes his neck to scrutinize you.
"I was rather hoping someone else would bring that up."
"If you got something to tell us..."

"Right fair point, that. Captain?"

His ear twitches.
"You don't look like you're going to be sick this time. So I take it that's a good sign...?"
"Eothas is heading to a place called 'Magran's Teeth.'"
[Shrug] "I'll live."
"If his goal is to bathe his nethers in molten rock, I'm in no hurry to stop him."
"The jawline of the northeastern sea? Treacherous waters."
"That sounds... ominous."
"All the places he can go, and he chooses a spot named for Magran. What could he be thinking?"
"Madiccho. No one ventures into Magran's Teeth. A chain of volcanoes guarded by giants, if the Huana legends are true."
"That be some right shit news, cap. Magran's Teeth be hot as the sun and twice the height."
"So what you're saying is we're headed to Magran's Teeth. Right?" She scratches the underside of her jaw, contemplating.
"You're looking upright, captain, but something in your eyes tells me different."

"You are well enough to travel? I do not want my captain senseless and babbling after too much revelation, ekera?" 

Tekēhu holds up an admonishing finger.
"I was actually wondering about you, though. How are you holding up?"

"What about you, though? 

"I'm getting flashes of those episodes you used to have in Dyrwood. You know - when you were going crazy?"
"I know you've become accustomed to your... abilities, but the stakes seem much higher here in the Deadfire. Are you all right?"
"You steady on your feet, cap? Don't need a swig or nothing?"
"I'm ready to chase Gaun if you are."
"Good thing we're in the Deadfire, where the volcanoes definitely aren't going to awaken at any time."
"Careful that we don't sail too close, captain. Magran's Teeth are sharp, and this handsome fish would make a handsome meal."
"Well. 'Magran's Teeth' sounds like the kind of place that should rather stick out. Shall we continue on?"
"It feels like we're getting closer... I just don't know to what."
"We made it through Sun-in-Shadow. We overcame Thaos. We can do this."
"Then we be charting a course for Magran's tits, er, Teeth. Ahem. Apologies, force of habit. ...Onwards, captain."
"All right, then. Let's do this." Xoti cracks her knuckles, eager.
"I'm doing fine. Really."
"It's strange, feeling part of my soul in the body of a god."
"More than ever, I'm determined to find Eothas."
"Eothas is not what I expected."
"If we had some idea where Eothas is headed next, maybe we could prevent a repeat of this."
"For what does Eothas keep walking away in the middle of a conversation? Where does he go next?"
"I don't suppose you happened to see where Eothas is headed next." He raises his eyebrows hopefully.
"Any word from our giant adra friend?"
"Did you discover where Eothas is going? He seems to cause more damage the farther he travels."
"Don't suppose the big blue bastard left you savvy to his destination?"
"Well? Where's my god headed now?"
[Specified 0] looks unconvinced.
"Magran's Teeth. It's notoriously perilous chain of volcanoes."
[Specified 0] looks at you, concerned.
[Specified 0] frowns thoughtfully.
[Specified 0] nods.
"You'll have to follow me if you want to find out..."
"Magran's Teeth, and he'd better have a damn good explanation when we get there."
"He's going to Magran's Teeth. Does that sound dangerous to you? Because it sounds dangerous to me."
"I'd be shocked if he didn't."
"It is not for the gods to explain. But that has never stopped me from asking."
"Remind me to stand back when you tell him so."
"That's one I'd like to be right up next to you to hear."
"Di verus. The gods all have some explaining to do. He more than most."
"Aye, 'cause the gods be known for explaining theirselves."
"One he deigns to tell us? Sure, I hope so."
"Admittedly, I've followed orders more vague than that." Maia sighs and folds her arms.

"Mother Ngati, how am I to tolerate this unrepentant tease of a captain?" 

Tekēhu folds his arms and grins.
"It's a good thing we're old friends, [Player Name]."
"Or we could wait till you're sleeping, hold you at knifepoint."
"I would think after this long that I've earned more trust than that."
"I'd say I'd follow you into Hel, cap, but then you'd be taking me up on it."
"You know I'd follow you into the depths of Hel. No need to ask twice, Watcher."
"Respectfully, captain... grow a spine. He's killed you once already. What more could he do?"
"That is your tension speaking. A visit to the bathhouse would do us both good, I say."
"Perhaps you misheard him. It's possible. Isn't it?"

"Don't lose your nerve on me now. What's he gonna do, kill you again?

"Yeah... guess he might."
"I know that no one ventures near Magran's Teeth. Not the Vailians, not the Royal Deadfire Company, not even the Huana."
"Nay cap. Nothing dangerous at all about chasing the big blue bastard into the bigger burning barnacle. Not a damn thing."
"Chasing a god's dangerous enough on it's own. Why worry about other details?"
